mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Robert Lewis to Martha Washington, 1800
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lewis, Robert, 1769-1829
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Received through brother Lawrence Lewis news that she desires settlement of rental for preceding year -- assures her he would have brought it sooner, had he had it, "... as it has ever been a rule with me never to retain money in my hands which was intended for or belonged to another person." -- has $100, and hopes to get rest from sheriff when the executions are returned -- requests that she pay no account against part of estate under his management -- there many claims against the General's estate which only he is acquainted with and she may be taken in -- please refer any such requests to him -- sorry for her indisposition -- suggests trip up country to Dr. David Stuart's may be beneficial. Autograph letter signed, draft, 2 pages, laminated.
